title: So i know that buying accounts will get them banned, but can a friend who quit give me his account?
body: One of my foreign exchange student buddies has a league account that he hasn't played on in years, and he said he would give the account to me. Will it get banned if i accept it?

replies.body:
I definitely wouldn't play ranked on it if you want it to stick around any length of time, and I would only play on it with the knowledge that it may very well be banned at some point. 

That said, sharing of abandoned accounts between friends or family isn't something that's enforced all that strictly if it isn't being used for malicious purposes (mmr boosting etc).

As HeartVine said, at the end of the day sharing accounts is still against RIot's rules, and enough of a reason for them to ban the account. It's a do at your own risk kind of deal.
It wont be banned. The chance of any one findding out is very, very slim. Its like torrenting files and thinking some 1 gonna catch you.

Bottom line is that selling, trading, gifting or otherwise sharing of accounts in any way is a direct breach of the ToU and EULA, and likely to result in a perma-ban. Chances are that it *will* be banned, sooner or later.
Not if you don't tell anyone ;) but it would probably, just be cautious and you'll be ok
